content.description: On the right side of Hercule's Foot is a wide crack with two bolts. Need a few cams from 1" to 3".
content.protection: 2 bolts, gear to 3" and 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Wide crack on the right side of the wall.

climbs.name: Toe Cutter
climbs.fa: Andy Litak, Reed Ames, Jay Crew, Rich Hoover.

content.description:
Steep start, and follows the diagonal crack up and right. Crux is in between bolt one and two. There's not much for feet, but a few small footholds, smears, and heel and toe Hooks can be used to help out.

Careful on the second clip!! Make sure your belayer is paying attention.
content.protection: 3 bolts and 2 bolt anchor with Mussy Hooks. lower off.

content.description: A short finger crack on good rock 10 feet left of Love Tractor
content.location: The middle of the north face of the boulder

content.description: Broken rock leads to a roof-like boulder problem at the first bolt. Higher, juggy climbing leads up a flare
Climb broken rock to a hard high step left at the second bolt. Above, sustained climbing leads into a stemming groove
content.location: Right of Toe Cutter, 2nd route from the left.

content.description:
Just to the left of the wide crack, near the right side of Hercule's Foot. Climbs up a dark patina face with excellent edges. Fun sequences and sustained climbing for the first 30 feet.

Start on the small rock, clip the first bolt, then step onto the wall.
content.location: Just to the left of Wide Spread Panic.

content.description: the arete on the right side of the N. face of the Bullpen boulder.

climbs.name: Hangnail
climbs.fa: Jay Crew, Jim Voss, Bill Holder

content.description: Starts 15 feet left of Big Piggie. Small roof at the start. Pull up and left to gain the face. A heel hook or left flag might help with this move. Continue up the face and slab at the top.
content.protection: Bolts and 2 bolt anchor. Lower off.
content.location: Near the middle of Hercule's Foot. Small roof at the start.

content.description: Slippery blank face made much easier with a nearby featured arête.
content.location: Bullpen Boulder is at the right end of Hercules foot, across from the nearby "space wrangler."  It hosts this slab climb, another bolted arete climb, and a trad line.

content.description: Start on the ground to the lower left side of the boulder. Climb up a crack to gain the sloping ledge and clip the first bolt. Move right for bolt 2, then get a high right heel hook, pull up into the cracks above, place another piece of gear or two, then finish on the slab above past another bolt.
content.protection: 3 bolts and gear to 1.5", 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Starts 20 feet left of space Wrangler, down on the ground to the lower left of the boulder.

content.description: Start off an undercut shelf 5m right of One Arm Steve and pull out left onto a blunt arete. Slabby moves lead up the arete. Avoid the temptation to move right into the flared crack, as this puts you out of sequence for the crux
content.location: Start right of One Arm Steve and left of Hangnail
